other_tests.findings: Initial ECG showed a ventricular rate of 56 beats per minute, atrioventricular dissociation, a right bundle-branch block, and nonspecific ST-segment abnormalities.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Follow-up ECG showed a ventricular rate of 101 beats per minute and atrial fibrillation, with incomplete right bundle-branch block, and nonspecific ST-segment and T-wave abnormalities.

other_tests.findings: Marked enlargement and hypokinesis of the right ventricle with moderate tricuspid insufficiency.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Follow-up echocardiogram performed 10 days later showed improvement in right ventricular size and function.

other_tests.findings: Mildly elevated homocysteine level, elevated IgG anticardiolipin antibody titer, and decreased functional protein C and protein C antigen levels.
Showed no evidence of thrombus in the femoral and popliteal veins.
